credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Design for ceiling decoration
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink (*check this*)
description: Horizontal rectangle. Caryatids support the entablature in the center and below the arch, at left. An urn stands between the pair in the center. Painting similar to -1534; with pendentives as wedges. A conch is shown over the entablature. The central painting is octagonal.
name: Drawing
